studies of [TRADENAME] in pregnant women. When treating pregnant 
women with [TRADENAME], carefully consider whether the potential 
benefits outweigh the potential risks of treatment. 
 
No teratogenic effects were observed when [drugname] was given to 
pregnant rats or rabbits during the period of organogenesis at oral doses 
up to 200 and 36 mg/kg/day, respectively. These doses are 48 and 17 
times, in rats and rabbits, respectively, the maximum recommended 
human dose (MRHD) of 40 mg
